meanings.definition: Remove or obliterate (something) by striking or crossing out.
meanings.sent1: She deleted the wrong answer from her paper.
meanings.sent2: Please make sure to delete any unnecessary files from the computer.
meanings.sent3: The magician 'deleted' the rabbit from the hat, much to the audience's surprise.
meanings.sent4: His anger 'deleted' any chance of a peaceful resolution.
meanings.sent5: The storm 'deleted' all traces of the sandcastle from the beach.

meanings.definition: To erase or remove data or information from a computer or electronic device.
meanings.sent1: He accidentally deleted his important presentation.
meanings.sent2: Remember to always double-check before hitting delete on your files.
meanings.sent3: The computer 'deleted' all the files just as the deadline approached, causing panic in the office.
meanings.sent4: The virus 'deleted' all the data on the hard drive, leaving it empty and useless.
meanings.sent5: The delete button 'deleted' the entire paragraph with one click.
